response_text: <rss version="2.0"><channel><ttl>60</ttl><title>Canada</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/topic/destination/canada</link><description>World news about Canada. Breaking news and archival information about its people, politics and economy from The New York Times.</description><copyright>Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company</copyright><language>en-us</language><item><title>Canada Fire Deals Staggering Blow to Oil Sands Industry and Economy</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/12/business/energy-environment/canadas-oil-sands-industry-staggers-after-a-devastating-fire.html</link><description>Companies either curbed production or shut down completely when the blaze struck Fort McMurray, Alberta, in an economic setback to the region.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 16:50:28 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Canadian Hotel Investment Trust to Be Sold for $1.6 Billion</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/12/business/dealbook/hotels-canada-innvest-bluesky.html</link><description>InnVest Real Estate Investment Trust, which holds 109 hotels in Canada, will be sold to a Canadian company backed by Hong Kong money.</description><author>By AMIE TSANG</author><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 03:14:08 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Global Warming Cited as Wildfires Increase in Fragile Boreal Forest</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/11/science/global-warming-cited-as-wildfires-increase-in-fragile-boreal-forest.html</link><description>Scientists say the near-destruction of Fort McMurray last week by a wildfire is the latest indication that the vital boreal forest is at risk from climate change.</description><author>By JUSTIN GILLIS and HENRY FOUNTAIN</author><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 20:54:20 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>In Fort McMurray, Fire Leaves a Black Line of Destruction</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/10/world/americas/fort-mcmurray-alberta-canada-fire.html</link><description>A school intact on one side of a street, a home devastated on the other. In Fort McMurray, Alberta, where a fire continued Monday, contrasts abound.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 20:59:57 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Musician to Know: Fashion’s New Favorite R&amp;B Artist</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/09/t-magazine/entertainment/black-atlass-island-love-rb-artist.html</link><description>Alex Fleming, who records as Black Atlass, has lent his voice to Saint Laurent and appeared front-row at Dior Homme. His track “Island Love” premieres here.</description><author>By NATHAN REESE</author><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 15:36:20 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Fort McMurray, a Canadian Oil Boom Town, Is Left in Ashes</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/09/world/americas/fort-mcmurray-fire-canada-oil-boom.html</link><description>Fast-moving wildfires have consumed entire swaths of a town that had drawn residents with fat paychecks and second chances, though some residents vow to rebuild.</description><author>By DAN LEVIN and IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 21:15:29 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Fort McMurray Fire Begins to Ease as Weather Cools</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/09/world/americas/fort-mcmurray-fire-begins-to-ease-as-weather-cools.html</link><description>Firefighters prepared to contain the Alberta blaze as officials started planning for residents’ return, but disruptions continued for companies involved in oil sands operations.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 19:17:04 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Refugees From Syria Among the Thousands Who Fled Canadian Fire</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/world/americas/refugees-from-syria-among-the-thousands-who-fled-canadian-fire.html</link><description>“Our bad luck followed,” said one woman, who lost her eyeglasses in the rush to evacuate a fire that has no obvious end.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN and DAN LEVIN</author><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 16:20:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Fleeing Fire in Canada’s Oil Country</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/07/opinion/fleeing-fire-in-canadas-oil-country.html</link><description>I think my house is still standing, but I’m not sure.</description><author>By KEVIN THORNTON</author><pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 22:33:12 -0500</pubDate></item><item><title>Inside the Fort McMurray Scorch Zone, Signs of Hasty Retreat and Nature’s Cruelty</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/07/world/americas/inside-the-fort-mcmurray-fire-zone-a-haunting-journey.html</link><description>Times photographer Tyler Hicks walked the streets of Fort McMurray, empty save for crews fighting the remaining flames and hundreds of melted homes.</description><author>By TYLER HICKS</author><pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 20:50:03 -0500</pubDate></item></channel></rss>
